info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 7:06AM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Virginia... South Anna River near Ashland affecting Hanover County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Anna River near Ashland. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flood lowlands downstream of gage in the vicinity of VA routes 686 and 667. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM EST Saturday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 07/18/1945. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM EST.
